title: How to Make Sultana Cake

steps.headline: Boil the sultanas for 20 minutes in sufficient water.
Strain and cool the sultanas.
Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.
Cream the butter and sugar together.
steps.description: Add the eggs and mix in well.

steps.headline: Add the dry ingredients followed by the boiled sultanas.
Pour into a lined or greased cake tin.
Bake for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
steps.description: The cake is ready when a skewer comes out clean.

steps.headline: Finished.
Preheat the oven to 140ºC (moderately slow).
steps.description: Prepare a round cake pan by either lining with parchment/baking paper or greasing with butter. You can also use both.

steps.headline: Place the sultanas, brandy and half of the water into a saucepan.
steps.description: Bring to a boil on medium to low heat. Allow to simmer until the liquid fills the fruit.

steps.headline: Add the cornflour to the mixture, along with the remaining water.
steps.description: Stir for 2 to 3 minutes, waiting for it to come to a boil and thicken.

steps.headline: Remove the saucepan from the heat.
steps.description: Cover with a lid or plastic wrap and leave to cool to lukewarm.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and sugar until fluffy.
steps.description: Add the eggs one at a time. Beat well after each egg is added.

steps.headline: Fold in the flour and add the baking powder.
steps.description: Then fold in the sultana mixture.

steps.headline: Transfer the sultana cake batter into the prepared pan.
steps.description: Smooth out the top to make it even.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven, on the middle shelf of your oven.
steps.description: Bake for 2 hours. It is ready when it is firm in the middle, when gently pushed.

steps.headline: Remove from the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Then remove it from the pan and allow to cool fully on the wire cooling rack.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 150ºF/130ºC.
steps.description: Prepare a loaf pan by either lining it with parchment (baking) paper or greasing with butter/margarine.

steps.headline: Place the butter, eggs, sultanas, marmalade or jam, sherry (or substitute) and flours into a mixing bowl.
Transfer the cake batter to the prepared loaf pan.
steps.description: Smooth out the top. Arrange the blanched almonds across the top of the loaf to form a topping. It can be random or added in a pattern, as preferred. Cover with foil.

steps.headline: Place the sultana loaf into the preheated oven.
Remove from the oven when baked.
steps.description: Let sit for 10 minutes in the pan, then allow to cool on a wire cooling rack.

steps.headline: Serve when cooled or slightly warm.
steps.description: It can be buttered or eaten as it is. Keep stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks, in an airtight container.

text: Sultana cake Boil the sultanas for 20 minutes in sufficient water.  Strain and cool the sultanas.  Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF.  Cream the butter and sugar together. Add the eggs and mix in well. Add the dry ingredients followed by the boiled sultanas. Combine well. Pour into a lined or greased cake tin.  Bake for 1 to 1 1/2 hours. The cake is ready when a skewer comes out clean. Finished.  Brandy sultana cake Preheat the oven to 140ºC (moderately slow). Prepare a round cake pan by either lining with parchment/baking paper or greasing with butter. You can also use both. Place the sultanas, brandy and half of the water into a saucepan. Bring to a boil on medium to low heat. Allow to simmer until the liquid fills the fruit. Add the cornflour to the mixture, along with the remaining water. Stir for 2 to 3 minutes, waiting for it to come to a boil and thicken. Remove the saucepan from the heat. Cover with a lid or plastic wrap and leave to cool to lukewarm. Cream the butter and sugar until fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time. Beat well after each egg is added. Fold in the flour and add the baking powder. Then fold in the sultana mixture. Transfer the sultana cake batter into the prepared pan. Smooth out the top to make it even. Place in the preheated oven, on the middle shelf of your oven. Bake for 2 hours. It is ready when it is firm in the middle, when gently pushed. Remove from the oven. Allow to cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Then remove it from the pan and allow to cool fully on the wire cooling rack. Sultana loaf Preheat the oven to 150ºF/130ºC. Prepare a loaf pan by either lining it with parchment (baking) paper or greasing with butter/margarine. Place the butter, eggs, sultanas, marmalade or jam, sherry (or substitute) and flours into a mixing bowl. Stir to combine well. Transfer the cake batter to the prepared loaf pan. Smooth out the top. Arrange the blanched almonds across the top of the loaf to form a topping. It can be random or added in a pattern, as preferred. Cover with foil. Place the sultana loaf into the preheated oven. Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Remove from the oven when baked. Let sit for 10 minutes in the pan, then allow to cool on a wire cooling rack. Serve when cooled or slightly warm. It can be buttered or eaten as it is. Keep stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks, in an airtight container.
